attributes.action: be legally obliged to bring a bill before parliament for a free vote on all petitions which attract more than 2 million signatures.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There are many surveys that show that the electorate feels disengaged from the political process.  Politicians generally hide behind the term “parliamentary democracy” as thought they know best and can therefore ignore public opinion.  The electorate is now better education and more informed than when this term was created.  Giving these petitions some real authority will enable the electorate to make a meaningful contribution to legislation.  A petition signature count of 2 million of the electorate is sufficient to demonstrate the seriousness of the issue and likely to deter special interest groups.
